contentrichtext.text: '''Viscount Templewood''', of Chelsea in the County of Middlesex, was a title in the [[Peerage of the United Kingdom]]. It was created in 1944 for the [[Conservative Party (UK)|Conservative]] politician and former [[Foreign Secretary]] and [[Home Secretary]], [[Samuel Hoare, 1st Viscount Templewood|Sir Samuel Hoare, 2nd Baronet]]. The '''Hoare Baronetcy''', of Sidestrand Hall in the County of Norfolk, had been created in the [[Baronetage of the United Kingdom]] on 7 August 1899 for his father [[Sir Samuel Hoare, 1st Baronet|Samuel Hoare]], who represented [[Norwich (UK Parliament constituency)|Norwich]] in the [[British House of Commons|House of Commons]]. Both titles became extinct on Lord Templewood's death in 1959. ==Hoare baronets, of Sidestrand Hall (1899)== *[[Sir Samuel Hoare, 1st Baronet]] (1841–1915) *[[Samuel Hoare, 1st Viscount Templewood|Sir Samuel John Gurney Hoare, 2nd Baronet]] (1880–1959) (created '''Viscount Templewood''' in 1944) ==Viscounts Templewood (1944)== *[[Samuel Hoare, 1st Viscount Templewood|Samuel John Gurney Hoare, 1st Viscount Templewood]] (1880–1959) ==See also== *[[Hoare baronets]] *[[Samuel Hoare Jr]] ==References== *{{Rayment|date=February 2012}} {{DEFAULTSORT:Templewood}} [[Category:Viscountcies in the Peerage of the United Kingdom]] [[Category:Extinct viscountcies in the Peerage of the United Kingdom]]
